subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to write tests that delete ONLY the data they create?
msgSnippet: Hi, ... Create a new database/scheme and copy all data from the QA-database to your new one. After the test, simply delete the database/scheme. Another

Subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to write tests that delete ONLY the data
 they create?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=120492285; y=ujYNsk8Yfy-PtKA-uCD06383vYsDLwLIZH1sjQHZ-QBCWQvJnt7D
X-Yahoo-Profile: kimmerin_job
From: Lothar Kimmeringer <maillists_job@...>

Hi,

Am 12.09.2016 um 17:59 schrieb lowell108@... [junit]:
>
> I'd like to be able to run some tests against fully populated QA databases. I
>  can't find the right combination of set-up and tear-down to erase ALL the data
>  created and inserted in the course of the test but not delete other data that
>  preexists in the Db.

Create a new database/scheme and copy all data from the QA-database to your
new one. After the test, simply delete the database/scheme.

Another solution is to use virtualization. Fire up a guest that is
configured to be rolled back to the state it was before when shut down.


Cheers, Lothar
